forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 55. North northwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 2 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
In the stillness of the early November night, Downtown San Francisco basks in a serene clarity, the stars peeking through a veil of tranquility above. The air is brisk, holding remnants of the day's warmth as temperatures settle around the mid-fifties. With a north-northwest wind whispering through the city, at times playfully gusting, the atmosphere feels vibrant yet comfortably cool, ideal for those who relish the invigorating embrace of the evening.

As dawn approaches, anticipate a sun-drenched Monday. The skies promise an uplifting blue, a perfect backdrop for the Golden Gate’s majestic silhouette. Daytime temperatures will gradually rise to a mild 68, only to drift slightly downwards in the afternoon chill—a reminder of the coastal essence that permeates this unique locale. Fog remains distant, allowing for expansive views and plentiful sunshine, creating an inviting landscape for wandering souls. For those contemplating their attire, layers will be essential; a light jacket or sweater will suffice in the morning, gradually yielding to lighter apparel as the sun ascends. With such inviting weather, an afternoon stroll along Embarcadero, perhaps a leisurely visit to a local café or an exploration of the vibrant streets, would harmonize beautifully with the day's peaceful rhythm, offering a reminder of San Francisco's effortless charm.
